instruction: Suggest a theory to explain why the Antarctic ice is melting.
output: One theory to explain why the Antarctic ice is melting is due to increasing global temperatures, caused by human-caused climate change. This has lead to a gradual increase in temperatures in the Antarctic region, causing the Antarctic ice to melt and contributing to sea levels rising. Other contributing factors can include ice shelf disintegration, ocean warming, changes in precipitation and wind patterns, and more.
